intro: Pseudostellaria sierrae, commonly known as Sierra starwort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of California. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats, often at higher elevations. Its small, star-shaped flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Pseudostellaria sierrae is a relatively rare species, making it of interest to botanists and conservationists.
